entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hwīt; akin to Old High German hwīz white and probably to Old Church Slavic světŭ light, Sanskrit śveta white, bright

def.dt: :free from color
:of the color of new snow or milk
:of the color white
:light or pallid in color white hair lips white with fear
:lustrous pale gray :silvery
:made of silver
:being a member of a group or race characterized by light pigmentation of the skin
:of, relating to, characteristic of, or consisting of white people or their culture
def.set: from the former stereotypical association of good character with northern European descent
def.dt: :marked by upright fairness that's mighty white of you
:free from spot or blemish: as
:free from moral impurity :innocent
:marked by the wearing of white by the woman as a symbol of purity a white wedding
:unmarked by writing or printing
:not intended to cause harm a white lie white magic
:favorable fortunate one of the white days of his life Sir Walter Scott
:wearing or habited in white
:marked by the presence of snow :snowy a white Christmas
:heated to the point of whiteness
:notably ardent :passionate white fury
:conservative or reactionary in political outlook and action
:instigated or carried out by reactionary forces as a counterrevolutionary measure a white terror
:of, relating to, or constituting a musical tone quality characterized by a controlled pure sound, a lack of warmth and color, and a lack of resonance
:consisting of a wide range of frequencies used of light, sound, and electromagnetic radiation
:the achromatic object color of greatest lightness characteristically perceived to belong to objects that reflect diffusely nearly all incident energy throughout the visible spectrum
:a white or light-colored part of something: as
:a mass of albuminous material surrounding the yolk of an egg
:the white part of the eyeball
:the light-colored pieces in a 2-player board game
:the player by whom these are played
:the area of a page unmarked by writing, printing, or illustration
:a white target
:the fifth or outermost circle of an archery target
:a shot that hits it
:one that is or approaches white in color: as
:white clothing often used in plural
:white wine
:a white mammal (as a horse or a hog)
:a white-colored product (as flour, pins, or sugar) usually used in plural
:any of numerous butterflies (subfamily Pierinae of the family Pieridae) that usually have the ground color of the wings white and are related to the sulphur butterflies
:teeth used in the phrase pearly whites
:leukorrhea
:a person belonging to a light-skinned race
:a member of a conservative or reactionary political group
:whiten
Andrew Dickson 1832–1918 Am. educ. & diplomat
river 690 miles (1110 kilometers) N Arkansas & SW Missouri flowing SE into Mississippi River
river 250 miles (402 kilometers) NW Colorado & E Utah flowing W into Green River
river 50 miles (80 kilometers) SW Indiana flowing W into the Wabash
river 325 miles (523 kilometers) S South Dakota flowing E into Missouri River
river 130 miles (209 kilometers) NW Texas
Byron Raymond 1917–2002 Am. jurist
Edward Douglass 1845–1921 Am. jurist; chief justice United States Supreme Court (1910–21)
Elwyn Brooks 1899–1985 Am. journalist & writer
Gilbert 1720–1793 Eng. clergyman & naturalist
Patrick Victor Martindale 1912–1990 Austral. writer
